sen.j: 紀止（きし、男性、生年（1753年±10） - 卒年（1799年以降））は、江戸時代中期の日本の篆刻家である。
sen.e: Kishi (male, 1753±10 - year of death was after 1799) was a tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving) in the mid-Edo period.
Kishi (male, 1753±10-year of death was after 1799) was a tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving) in the mid-Edo period.
sen.cmt: ハイフン前後のスペース削除しました。
sen.e: Kishi (male, 1753±10-year of death was after 1799) was an artist of seal engraving who lived during the mid-Edo period.

sen.j: 字は子基または仲敬、号 (称号)に鹿銜・三学がある。
sen.e: His azana (adult male's nickname) was Shiki or Chukei, and his second names or alias include Rokugan and Sangaku.
His azana (adult male's nickname) were Shiki and Chukei, and his pseudonyms included Rokugan and Sangaku.
sen.cmt: 複数化、andに変更、号をpseudonymに変更、過去化しました。
sen.e: His azana (adult male's nickname) were Shiki and Chukei, and his pseudonyms included Rokugan and Sangaku.
His common name was Keizo NISHIMURA.
His popular name was Keizo NISHIMURA.
sen.cmt: 通称の表現変更しました。
sen.e: His popular name was Keizo NISHIMURA.
He was from Kyoto.
He was from Kyoto.
He was from Kyoto.
Brief biography
Brief biography
Brief biography

sen.j: 幼少のころから学問を好み、永田観鵞門下で書の手習いをよくした。
sen.e: He liked to study since he was very young, and practiced Calligraphy under Kanga NAGATA.
He liked to study since he was very young, and practiced calligraphy under Kanga NAGATA.
He liked to study since he was very young, and practiced calligraphy under Kanga NAGATA.
He also enjoyed seal engraving.
He also enjoyed seal engraving.
He also enjoyed seal engraving.

sen.j: 若いときに方寸の青田石の印面に「仁義礼智信」の五文字を刻し、天明2年（1782年）には一寸八分の印面に千字文を刻し有名になる。
sen.e: He became famous for carving five letters that mean 'benevolence, justice, courtesy, wisdom and sincerity' on the stamping surface of a 3 centimeters square qingtian stone when he was young and carving 1,000 letters on the stamping surface of 5.5 centimeters square in 1782.
sen.cmt: 「方寸」は用語集にhosun (a square sun)とありましたが、これでは意味が通らない可能性がありますので 3 centimeters squareとしました。
sen.e: He became famous for carving five letters that mean 'benevolence, justice, courtesy, wisdom and sincerity' on a stamp surface of a three centimeter square qingtian stone when he was young, and carving 1,000 letters on a stamp surface of 5.5 centimeter square in 1782.
sen.cmt: 単数化、数字の文字化、冠詞変更、stampingをstampに変更しました。
sen.e: He became famous for carving five letters that mean 'benevolence, justice, courtesy, wisdom and sincerity' on a stamp surface of a 3 sq.cm qingtian stone when he was young, and carving 1,000 letters on the face of a 5.5 cm seal in 1782.
sen.cmt: three centimeter square→3 sq.cm.「一寸八分(5.4cm)」は「方」がないので面積かどうか不明ですが、「丈が54mm＝一寸八分で、大吉数「18」と縁起が良い」ため印鑑に使用される長さなので5.4 sq.cmよりも5.4 cmの印面としました。a stamp surface of 5.5 centimeter square→the face of a 5.5 cm seal としました。

sen.j: 前川虚舟と並び細字篆刻の第一人者と見られる。
sen.e: He was regarded as a leading person in the field of seal-engraving of small letters along with Kyoshu MAEKAWA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was regarded as a leading person in the field of seal-engraving of small letters along with Kyoshu MAEKAWA.
He was regarded as a leading person in the field of seal-engraving of small letters along with Kyoshu MAEKAWA.

sen.j: 釈慈周はその技を絶賛し七言絶句を贈っている。
sen.e: Jishu SHAKU praised him to the skies and presented a shichigon zekku (a Chinese poem of four lines, each of seven characters).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Jishu SHAKU praised his skill and presented a shichigon zekku (a Chinese poem of four lines, each of seven characters).
sen.cmt: skiesをskillに変更、一部短縮しました。
sen.e: Jishu SHAKU praised his skill and presented a shichigon zekku (a Chinese poem of four lines, each of seven characters).

sen.j: 寛政3年（1791年）に丸山にて賀宴を催し、数百人以上の来場があった。
sen.e: In 1791, he held a party in Maruyama and more than a few hundred people came.
In 1791, he held a banquet in Maruyama and more than a few hundred people came.
In 1791, he held a banquet in Maruyama and more than a few hundred people came.

sen.j: その宴の中で105方の印を刻し、『利其器斎印譜』とした。
sen.e: At the party, he engraved seals of 105方 and made it as "Rikikisai Inpu."
sen.cmt: 「105方」の意味がわかりませんでした。
sen.e: At the banquet, he engraved the seal of 105方 and made it as "Rikikisai Inpu."
sen.cmt: partyを変更、itを使用していることから単数化しました。
sen.e: At the banquet, he engraved the seal of 105方 and made it as "Rikikisai Inpu."

sen.j: 他に印譜『利其器斎印稿』がある。
sen.e: There is also another Inpu "Rikikisai Inko."
There is also another Inpu "Rikikisai Inko."
There is also another Inpu "Rikikisai Inko."
